about_the_game:
Dreadnoughts of Caelus is a first-person 3D action flight sim.

Far from Earth, a city floats in the bottomless blue-green mists of the ice giant Caelus, its inhabitants lost in dreams. A dreadnought is coming for them, an immense ship dwarfing your jet fighters. Can you stop it in time, or will you just chip off some of its resources to strengthen your defense of another city?

Featuring fully destructible dreadnoughts with multiple systems to target, to weaken its defenses, slow it down, degrade its capabilities, liberate its resources, and eventually send it plunging into the depths of Caelus.

linux_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: 64-bit and runs Steam
  • Processor: 2-core 2 GHz with SSE3 support
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: OpenGL 4.6 compatible with 2 GB VRAM
  • Storage: 128 MB available space
linux_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Additional Notes: Dual-analog-stick, dual-analog-trigger gamepad is highly recommended and sufficient for the main game. Side content, special modes, and creative activities may require a mouse and keyboard.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10 64-bit
  • Processor: 2-core 2 GHz with SSE3 support
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: OpenGL 4.6 compatible with 2 GB VRAM
  • Storage: 128 MB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • Processor: 4-core 4 GHz CPU
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVidia 3060 RTX
  • Additional Notes: Dual-analog-stick, dual-analog-trigger gamepad is highly recommended and sufficient for the main game. Side content, special modes, and creative activities may require a mouse and keyboard.

short_description: Smash up a huge fully-destructible dreadnought in your fighter craft! Dreadnoughts of Caelus is a first-person 3D action flight sim. Race against time to defend your floating city in the bottomless blue-green mists of Caelus. Will you chip away at its systems, or dive for its weak points?
